property.name: storage.data.store.class
property.description: Default class for storing data

property.name: tika.uppercase.element.names
property.description: Determines whether TikaParser should uppercase the element name while generating the DOM for a page, as done by Neko (used per default by parse-html)(see NUTCH-1592).

property.name: tika.extractor
property.description: Which text extraction algorithm to use. Valid values are: boilerpipe or none.

property.name: tika.extractor.boilerpipe.algorithm
property.description: Which Boilerpipe algorithm to use. Valid values are: DefaultExtractor, ArticleExtractor or CanolaExtractor.

property.name: elastic.host
property.description: Comma-separated list of hostnames to send documents to using TransportClient. Either host and port must be defined or cluster.

property.name: elastic.port
property.description: The port to connect to using TransportClient.

property.name: elastic.cluster
property.description: The cluster name to discover. Either host and port must be defined or cluster.

property.name: elastic.index
property.description: Default index to send documents to.

property.name: elastic.max.bulk.docs
property.description: Maximum size of the bulk in number of documents.

property.name: elastic.max.bulk.size
property.description: Maximum size of the bulk in bytes.

property.name: elastic.exponential.backoff.millis
property.description: Initial delay for the BulkProcessor's exponential backoff policy.

property.name: elastic.exponential.backoff.retries
property.description: Number of times the BulkProcessor's exponential backoff policy should retry bulk operations.

property.name: elastic.bulk.close.timeout
property.description: Number of seconds allowed for the BulkProcessor to complete its last operation.

property.name: elastic.rest.host
property.description: The hostname to send documents to using Elasticsearch Jest. Both host and port must be defined

property.name: elastic.rest.port
property.description: The port to connect to using Elasticsearch Jest.

property.name: elastic.rest.index
property.description: Default index to send documents to.

property.name: elastic.rest.type
property.description: Default type to send documents to.

property.name: elastic.rest.max.bulk.docs
property.description: Maximum size of the bulk in number of documents.

property.name: elastic.rest.max.bulk.size
property.description: Maximum size of the bulk in bytes.

property.name: elastic.rest.https
property.description: "true" to enable https, "false" to disable https If you've disabled http access (by forcing https), be sure to set this to true, otherwise you might get "connection reset by peer".

property.name: elastic.rest.user
property.description: Username for auth credentials (only used when https is enabled)

property.name: elastic.rest.password
property.description: Password for auth credentials (only used when https is enabled)

property.name: elastic.rest.trustallhostnames
property.description: "true" to trust elasticsearch server's certificate even if its listed domain name does not match the domain they are hosted on "false" to check if the elasticsearch server's certificate's listed domain is the same domain that it is hosted on, and if it doesn't, then fail to index (only used when https is enabled)

property.name: metatags.names
property.description: Names of the metatags to extract, separated by ','. Use '*' to extract all metatags. Prefixes the names with 'metatag.' in the parse-metadata. For instance to index description and keywords, you need to activate the plugin index-metadata and set the value of the parameter 'index.parse.md' to 'metatag.description,metatag.keywords'.

property.name: index.parse.md
property.description: Comma-separated list of keys to be taken from the parse metadata to generate fields. Can be used e.g. for 'description' or 'keywords' provided that these values are generated by a parser (see parse-metatags plugin)

property.name: index.content.md
property.description: Comma-separated list of keys to be taken from the content metadata to generate fields.

property.name: index.db.md
property.description: Comma-separated list of keys to be taken from the crawldb metadata to generate fields. Can be used to index values propagated from the seeds with the plugin urlmeta

property.name: selenium.driver
property.description: A String value representing the flavour of Selenium WebDriver() to use. Currently the following options exist - 'firefox', 'chrome', 'safari', 'opera', 'phantomJS', and 'remote'. If 'remote' is used it is essential to also set correct properties for 'selenium.hub.port', 'selenium.hub.path', 'selenium.hub.host' and 'selenium.hub.protocol'.

property.name: libselenium.page.load.delay
property.description: The delay in seconds to use when loading a page with lib-selenium. This setting is used by protocol-selenium and protocol-interactiveselenium since they depending on lib-selenium for fetching.
